org.safs.model

Interface TestRecordParametersInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCommand, AbstractTestRecord, AbstractTestTable, AlternateLoginTests, BlockID, Breakpoint, Command, ComponentFunction, CycleTestTable, DriverCommand, EngineCommand, LoginWinTests, Logon, ProjectCommand, Regression, Skipped, StepTestTable, SuiteTestTable

    public interface TestRecordParametersInterface
    Define the minimal interface needed to identify an item that can export a newline-terminated String that is the test record needed to invoke its functionality. That is, it returns the line used to invoke it.

    Example: There may be a pre-defined "Logon" StepTestTable that takes two parameters; userid and password. To invoke this StepTestTable will require a test record line like:

    T, Logon, , ^userid="userid", ^password="password"

    This interface defines the method needed to get that line from the StepTestTable instance. The same interface is used for commands, as well.

    • Method Detail

      • exportTestRecord

        java.lang.String exportTestRecord(java.lang.String fieldSeparator)
        Export a properly formatted test record. Use the provided separator to delimit fields in the record.
        Parameters:
        fieldSeparator - -- separates fields in the test record
        Returns:
        String test record

      • getParameters

        java.util.List getParameters()
        Return the list of parameters for this test record.
        Returns:
        List of parameters for the test record (if any). Should return a zero-length array if there are no parameters.

      • addParameter

        void addParameter(java.lang.String parameter)
        Add a parameter to be used with this test record.
        Parameters:
        parameter - -- might be null or zero-length

      • addParameters

        void addParameters(java.lang.String[] parameters)
        Add an array of parameters to be used with this test record.
        Parameters:
        parameters - -- non-null array of parameters to be added

      • appendParametersToTestRecord

        java.lang.StringBuffer appendParametersToTestRecord(java.lang.StringBuffer buffer,
                                                  java.lang.String fieldSeparator)
        Append the stored test record parameters during an export operation. This is called by the export mechanism and is not normally called by the user.
        Parameters:
        buffer - -- StringBuffer holding the test record being exported
        fieldSeparator - -- separator used to delimit parameters
        Returns:
        buffer with our test record parameters appended
